properties.headline: Flood Watch issued February 5 at 2:45PM PST until February 8 at 2:48PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
Lower Columbia / SW Washington Rivers Bulletin

...The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a flood watch
for the following river in Washington...

Cowlitz River at Kelso affecting Cowlitz County

.There is an threat of flooding along the lower Cowlitz due to a
combination of increased releases from Mayfield Dam starting later
today and increased flows on the Toutle River starting Thursday.

A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts. Monitor later forecasts and be alert for
possible Flood Warnings.

River forecasts are based on observed and forecast rainfall and
temperatures, and they include current and planned reservoir
releases. For the latest river stages and forecasts, visit
weather.gov/portland.

The next update for this location will be issued by 2 pm Thursday.

The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a
* Flood Watch for
The Cowlitz River at Kelso.
* From late Thursday night until Saturday afternoon.
* At 2 PM Wednesday the stage was 18.1 feet / MSG cfs.
* Minor flooding is possible.
* Forecast...This river may reach flood stage Thursday evening or
early Friday morning. It is forecast to crest between 21.5 and 22.0
feet Friday morning.
* Impact...Above 21.5 ft, flooding of several low lying and secondary
roads begins, including the Cowlitz Gardens neighborhood, along
with flooding of pasture and lowland upstream of Kelso.
